BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
AREA VIII
PHYSICAL PLANT AND
FACILITIES
B. BUILDINGS

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.1. The buildings meet all
requirements of the
Building Code. A
Certificate of Occupancy
for each building is
conspicuously displayed.

Land Ownership (MOA)

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.2. The buildings are
constructed according to
their respective uses.
Click button below to view pdf
Building Plan

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.3. The buildings are well-
planned and appropriately
located to provide for
future expansion.
To be updated

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.4. Entry and exit points
permit the use of the
buildings for public and
other functions with
minimum interference to
school activities.

The entry and exit points permit
the use of the buildings for public
and other functions and free from
hazards

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.5. Emergency exits are
provided and properly
marked.
To be updated

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.6. The buildings are
equipped with
emergency/fire escapes
which are readily accessible.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.7. The corridors, doorways,
and alleys are well-
constructed for better
mobility.
Alley and doorway

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.8. The buildings are well-
ventilated and lighted.

Electrical Plan of Building

Rooms are well-
ventilated with proper
lightings
TGG 302
TGG 201

Rooms are well-ventilated with proper
lightings

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S9. The buildings have
facilities for persons with
disability (PWDs) as
provided by law.
PWD Ramp at MSF Building

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.10.There is a central signal
and fire alarm system.
To be updated

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.11.There are readily
accessible and functional
fire extinguishers and other
fire-fighting equipment.

A readily available and functional
fire extinguisher located on every
rooms and building of the campus

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.12.Bulletin boards, display
boards, waste disposal
containers and other
amenities are strategically
located inside the buildings.
Bulletin boards

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.13.There are faculty rooms
and offices.
MSF 101: Faculty Room Entrance

Reading room and
Research development &
extension/accreditation
room

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.14.The buildings are insured.
To be updated

IMPLEMENTATION
I.1. The buildings are clean,
well-maintained and free
from vandalistic acts.
Clean and well-maintained environment
Clean and well-maintained rooms
Clean and well-maintained rooms

IMPLEMENTATION
I.2. Toilets are clean and well-
maintained.
Clean and well-maintained toilets for students
Clean and well-maintained toilets for faculty

IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. Electrical lines are safely
installed and periodically
checked.
Click button below to view pdf
Electrical Blueprint of Building

IMPLEMENTATION
I.4. Water facilities are
functional and well-
distributed in all buildings.
Portable water supply at faculty office

Potable Water Supply at Psychological
Testing Room

IMPLEMENTATION
I.5. There is a periodic
potability testing of
drinking water.
To be updated

IMPLEMENTATION
I.6. Floor plans indicating fire
exits and location of fire-
fighting equipment,
standpipes, and other
water sources are
conspicuously displayed
in each building.
To be updated

IMPLEMENTATION
I.7. All school facilities are
periodically subjected to
pest control and
inspection.
To be updated

IMPLEMENTATION
I.8. Smoking is strictly
prohibited inside the
campus.
To be updated

OUTCOME/S
O.1. The buildings and other
facilities are safe, well-
maintained and
functional.

MSF Building
RPD Building
TGG Building

functionally designed.
